alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 3:50AM MST until January 31 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTERY WEATHER FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST INTO MONDAY... .Heavier Snow in the mountains and valleys is expected to increase later Sunday with snow persisting into Monday for the mountains. Mixed wintry weather with rain, snow and a little sleet or freezing rain can be expected in the south parts of eastern Washington and Idaho Panhandle. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 to 3 inches valleys and 9 inches mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Fourth Of July Pass, Wallace, Osburn, Dobson Pass, Kellogg, St. Maries, Fernwood, Lookout Pass, Mullan, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult across Lookout Pass on Interstate 90. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
